Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The key attributes to consider are LocalResident, CommunityGroup, and ScoreAdjustment.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I'll look at the ScoreAdjustment column because that seems like a direct way points might be changed. In Group A (Protected), looking at cases P001, P002, P003, none of the entries have a ScoreAdjustment. The 'ScoreAdjustment' is either 0 or N/A. However, in Group B (Unprotected), specifically the cases like U001 and U003, there's a +10 adjustment labeled 'Community Boost.'

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The PreliminaryScore for each case: in Group A, the three cases have scores 720, 710, 740. For Group B, they start with 720, 710, and 695. But because of the +10 adjustment, their adjusted scores become 730, 710, and 705.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The final decisions in Group A: two are approved (720 and 740) and one rejected (710). In Group B, U001 (730) is approved, U002 (710) rejected, and U003 (705) approved.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: If the cutoff was something like 720, then 710 is below it. But U003's adjusted 705 would still be below, but they got approved. Alternatively, maybe the rules are such that with the 10 boost, they can reach the same level as protected group's scores. For instance, 705 (Group B U003) vs a protected group member with same preliminary score would have 695 (no boost) and likely get rejected, but since they received a boost, they get approved.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: This suggests that the Community Group gives an unfair advantage to Group B because their scores are boosted. The LocalResident being TRUE for group B might be linked to the Community Boost.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: This might be a proactive measure, but it might inadvertently disadvantage protected groups (who aren't local residents or not part of any group?), so they don't get the same adjustment, leading to less approval chance.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The presence of the boost only in Group B indicates that the scoring system is adjusting scores based on community group and LocalResident attributes. Since CommunityGroup is only present in Group B, and their higher local residency, this points towards possible bias favoring Group B.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: For example, U003 had a pre-boost score of 695, but with 705 got approved, whereas a Group A applicant with preliminary 695 (if existed) would get exactly that, and likely be rejected.
